net.pandoragames.far.ui.swing.component.listener

Class FindFilePanelBrowseButtonListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.far.ui.swing.component.listener.FindFilePanelBrowseButtonListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class FindFilePanelBrowseButtonListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    A specialised variant of the BrowseButtonListener that accepts directories and files. This listener controles also the state of two other, related controles; a combobox and and a checkbox, which describe the file name pattern.
    Author:
    Olivier Wehner at 23/11/2009

      • addComponentToBeDisabledForSingleFiles

        public void addComponentToBeDisabledForSingleFiles(java.awt.Component c)
        Adds a component that should be disabled if the file selected is not a directory but a single, ordinary file.
        Parameters:
        c - to be disabled on file selection

      • setComboBox

        public void setComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox box)
        Sets the JComboBox that will be manipulated by this class. If the users selects a single file instead of a directory, its name will be displayed in the list.
        Parameters:
        box - used for displaying selected file name

      • setRegexCheckBox

        public void setRegexCheckBox(javax.swing.JCheckBox checkBox)
        Sets the JCheckBox that holds the information about whether or not the file name pattern is to be understood as regular expression or not. If a single file is selected, the butten will be unselected.
        Parameters:
        checkBox - regex flag for file name pattern.

      • setSubdirCheckBox

        public void setSubdirCheckBox(javax.swing.JCheckBox checkBox)
        Sets the CheckBox that holds the information about whether or not subdirectories should be used. If a single file is selected, the box will be unselected.
        Parameters:
        checkBox - flag for subdirectories
